zambian.text: When you show the moon to a child, it sees only your finger.
The worlds of the elders do not lock all the doors; they leave the right door open.
When you show the moon to a child, it sees only your finger.
You can learn a lot about someone by observing him when he is hungry.
If two wise men always agree, then there is no need for one of them.
When your luck deserts you, even cold food burns.
The more feathers a chicken has, the bigger it looks.
A riddle made by God has no solution.
You learn a lot about a man by his behavior when hungry.
Where God cooks, there is no smoke.
When your luck deserts you, even cold food burns.
